muster.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to get enough courage, confidence, support etc to do something, especially with difficulty
muster.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Senator Newbolt has been trying to muster support for his proposals.
‘It’s going to be fine, ’ replied David, with as much confidence as he could muster.
Finally I mustered up the courage to ask her out.
muster (up) the courage/confidence/energy etc to do something
muster.translation[0].definitions[1].def: if soldiers muster, or if someone musters them, they come together in a group
muster.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: In April 1185, he began to muster an army.
muster.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a gathering together of soldiers so that they can be counted, checked etc
